author: electricmastro

text:
See, it could be that they kept Earthbound around until they needed to move more systems, more of a business decision than legal issues. I mean, I ordered my Wii U to play the game and I know a few who can attest to doing the same. It could also be to fill out the Wii U's library at a comparatively slow time.

I would like to think they did it because of the fanbase, but if that was the case they would have done it long ago.
author: TrippleCyan

text: I hope we get gamecube games next.
author: Bosspuma

text: It took 7-8 years, but we finally made it to that point. Nintendo announcing NES, SNES, and GBA titles for Wii U would be perfect for the series to be released on.
author: electricmastro

text: Rejoice Earthbound fans, Nintendo﻿ hasn't completely given up on us outside of Japan! Today's announcement about its Wii U VC release made me very happy, especially knowing how hard/expensive the original cartidge is. So I have to wonder, what previously kept Nintendo from releasing it? We always thought it was because of copyright problems around the soundtrack, but why would that suddenly not matter anymore? Next step, getting Mother and Mother 3 officially translated!
author: SupraDarky
